answers.text: descendants of the "anusim" forced converts to Catholicism

qas.question: Who are descendants of the "anusim" forced converts to Catholicism?
What percentage of Iberians are Sephardic Bnei Anusim?
Who are the descendants of the willing converts to Catholicism?
What percentage of historical Iberia was Sephardic Bnei Anusim?
What percentage of ancient Ibero-America was Sephardic Bnei Anusim?
What population does not have some more remote ancient Jewish descent?
What other population does not have some more remote ancient Jewish descent?

context: The studies also show that the <a1_0><b3_0>Sephardic Bnei Anusim<b3_0/><a1_0/> (<a0_0>descendants of the "anusim" forced converts to Catholicism<a0_0/>) of Iberia (estimated at about <a2_0><b4_0>19.8<b4_0/>%<a2_0/> of modern Iberia) and Ibero-America (estimated at least <b5_0>10<b5_0/>% of modern Ibero-America) have Sephardic Jewish origins within the last few centuries, while the Bene Israel and <b6_0>Cochin Jews of India<b6_0/>, <b7_0>Beta Israel of Ethiopia<b7_0/>, and a portion of the Lemba people of Southern Africa, despite more closely resembling the local populations of their native countries, also have some more remote ancient Jewish descent.
